content: quote: Originally posted by mlenardo: i wanted to know what happens to my retirement money if i am a national guardmans and i did no t live to the age of 65 do my wife recieve my pay It's 60...not 65. As for your retirement, if you live long enough to get there, you are given one of several choices. The first is that you get 100% of your retirement at age 60, but if you die, all retirement stops, even if your wife is still alive. Another is that you take 50% of your retirement, but if you die, your wife continues to get 50%. I would assume, if you opt for the first one and die before you are 60, neither you nor your wife would ever get a dime, but if you went for the second choice, your wife would start drawing 50% when you would have reached 60. I have opted for the 50% option and will be 60 in a year, so I'm hoping Obama and the Democrats don't figure out how to screw me out of that first check - - Wandering and Wondering
quote: Originally posted by mlenardo: i wanted to know what happens to my retirement money if i am a national guardmans and i did no t live to the age of 65 do my wife recieve my pay
